newsitem.title: GERMANY: Arthuis says France wants more talks on fx swings.
newsitem.headline: Arthuis says France wants more talks on fx swings.

text.p: French Finance Minister Arthuis said France wanted European Union ministers to hold further talks on how to combat excessive currency fluctuations.

France had proposed that EU structural funds be paid in national currencies rather than Ecus to dissuade countries from devaluing their currencies to gain a competitive trade advantage. But its proposal ran into opposition from various member states and the European Commission.
"The response made by the Commission should not put an end to this question," Arthuis told a news conference after Franco-German economic talks.

Official sources say France would like EU finance ministers meeting in Dublin this weekend to consider ways of combating excessive currency fluctuations in the bloc and ask the Commission to come up with proposals as to how this could be done.
